* @param time This is the time for which that action has to happen.
assert description != null : "description cannot be null";
assert time != null : "date cannot be null";
* This method indicates that a new Deadline Task has been added to the ArrayList in Store.
return "Got it. I've added this task: \n" + " [D]" + super.toString() + "| by: " + time;
* This method return the time of this Deadline Task.
* @return String This is the time for the deadline.
* This method create a new Duke object.
* If file exist, load the file. Otherwise create new file.
File file = new File(filepath); //create a file obj with the given filepath.
this.lib = new Store(file); //create store from absolute filepath
//The container for the content of the chat to scroll.
sendButton = new Button("Send");       //set button with "Send" label

* Creates a label with the specified text and adds it to the dialog container.
* @param text String containing text to add
* @return a label with the specified text that has word wrap enabled.
* Creates two dialog boxes, one echoing user input and the other containing Duke's reply and then appends them to
* the dialog container. Clears the user input after processing.
* This method generate a response to user input.
* @return String of the the response of user input.
* This method return the Error Message for Incorrect Input.
return "OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.\nPlease insert Action\n";
* This method return the Error Message for Incorrect Input for a Deadline Task.
return "OOPS!!! The description of a Deadline cannot be empty.\nPlease insert Action\n" ;
* This method return the Error Message for Incorrect Input for a Event Task.
return "OOPS!!! The description of a Event cannot be empty.\nPlease insert Action\n";
* This method return the Error Message for Missing Date in Deadline Task.
return "OOPS!!! Deadline is missing a Date!\nPlease input Date\n";
* This method return the Error Message for Missing Date in Event Task.
return "OOPS!!! Event is missing a Date!\nPlease input Date\n";
* This method return the Error Message for Invalid Input.
return "OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means.\n";
* This method return the Error Message for Invalid Number.
return "Invalid Number. Please Enter a valid number.\n";
* This method return the Error Message for Invalid Date Format.
return "Invalid Date Format! Enter in /by yyyy-mm-dd\n";
* This method return the Error Message for Invalid Time Format.
return "Invalid Date Format! Enter in hh:mm\n";
* This method return Error Message for No Matched Found.
return "What you are looking for does not exist.\n";
* This method return the Error Message for Missing Done Index.
* This method updates the action and time accordingly for Events.
* @param description This is the details for Event.
* @param time This is the time for the Event.
assert description != null : "Description cannot bve empty";
assert time != null : "Time cannot be empty";
* This method indicates that a new Event Task has been added to the ArrayList in Store.
return "Got it. I've added this task: \n" + " [E]" + super.toString() + "| at: " + time;
* This method return the time of this Event Task.
* @return String This is the time for the Event.
* A GUI for Duke using FXML.
* Controller for MainWindow. Provides the layout for the other controls.
* Creates two dialog boxes, one echoing user input and the other containing Duke's reply and then appends them to
* the dialog container. Clears the user input after processing.
private DateFormat inputDate = new SimpleDateFormat("dd/MM/yyyy");  //input date format of dd/mm/yyyy
private DateFormat inputTime = new SimpleDateFormat("HHmm");        //input time in hhmm
private DateFormat outputDate = new SimpleDateFormat("MMM dd yyyy");//output in MMM dd yyyy
private DateFormat outputTime = new SimpleDateFormat("hh:mm a");    //output in hh:mm PM/AM
* This method updates the existing variables.
* @param file This is the absolute file for storing the Task onto the hard disk.
* This method prints out message for "bye" action.
* This method prints the elements in the ArrayList<Task>.
* This method updates the Task at the index to complete.
* @param index Indicates which item on the ArrayList Storage.
assert index < Storage.size() : "Index cannot be greater than list";
assert index > 0 : "Index cannot be 0 or negative";
* This method add a new Task to the ArrayList<Task>.
* @param S The action to be done.
* @return String This returns the number of task currently.
assert S != null : "input string cannot be null";
+ String.format("\nNow you have %d tasks in the list.\n", Storage.size());
* This method add a new Deadline Task to the ArrayList<Task>
* @param actionTime Contains the Action and the Date and/or Time.
* @return the String of the new deadline task.
assert actionTime.length > 0 : "Deadline details cannot be empty";
+ String.format("\nNow you have %d tasks in the list.\n", Storage.size());
* This method add a new Event Task to the ArrayList<Task>
* @param actionTime Contains the Action and Date and/or Time.
String output = T.output() + String.format("\nNow you have %d tasks in the list.", Storage.size());
* This method remove the Task at the index from the ArrayList.
* @param index Indicates which item on the ArrayList<Task> Storage.
* @return the String of the task deleted.
assert index < Storage.size() : "index value greater than list";
assert index > 0 : "index cannot be 0 or negative.";
* This method writes the ArrayList<Task> to the file on the hard disk.
* This method load existing file onto the ArrayList<Task> Storage.
* @param S This is the Task from the file to be loaded from.
* This method checks if Tasks in the loaded file is completed.
* @return boolean This return true if the task has been completed.
* This method finds Task that contains the Action.
* @param Action This is the Action to be located in the ArrayList<Task> Storage.
* @return the String of all the items in the list that match.
output = "Here are the matching tasks in your list:\n";
* This method format the input detail to date and time.
* @param detail This is the string to be formatted.
protected String description; //action to be taken
protected boolean isDone; //status of the action
* This methods updates the Task action and indicate that it is incomplete.
* @param description This is the action for the Task.
* This methods changes the status icon.
* This method set the status icon to 1 for easier storage.
* This method updates the action to be taken.
* @param description This is the action to be taken.
assert description != null : "Description cannot be empty";
* This method indicates that a new Task has been added to the ArrayList in Store.
return "Got it. I've added this task: \n" + " [T]" + super.toString();
* This method forms a divider line.
* @return String This is the line to be return.
* This method prints the welcome message when user first run the program.
return "Hi, welcome to Duke! \nHow can I help you?";
* This method return the Bye Message.
* @return String This is the bye message.
return "Bye. Hope to see you again soon!";
* This method forms the Delete action message.
* @param Action This is the Action to be deleted.
* @param amt This is the amount of element in the storage.
* @return String This is the Message for the Delete action.
public String DeleteMessage(String Action, int amt){
String Output = String.format("\nNow you have %d tasks in the list\n", amt);
return "Noted. I've removed this task: \n" + Action + Output;
* This method forms the message for the Done action.
* @param Action This is the action that has been completed.
* @return This is the message for the Done action.
return "Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n" + Action;

<fx:root alignment="TOP_RIGHT" maxHeight="1.7976931348623157E308" maxWidth="1.7976931348623157E308" prefWidth="400.0" type="javafx.scene.layout.HBox" xmlns="http://javafx.com/javafx/8.0.171" xmlns:fx="http://javafx.com/fxml/1">

<AnchorPane maxHeight="-Infinity" maxWidth="-Infinity" minHeight="-Infinity" minWidth="-Infinity" prefHeight="600.0" prefWidth="400.0" style="-fx-background: #ffffff" xmlns="http://javafx.com/javafx/8.0.171" xmlns:fx="http://javafx.com/fxml/1" fx:controller="MainWindow">
<TextField fx:id="userInput" layoutY="558.0" onAction="#handleUserInput" promptText="Enter commands" prefHeight="41.0" prefWidth="324.0" AnchorPane.bottomAnchor="1.0" />
<Button fx:id="sendButton" layoutX="324.0" layoutY="558.0" style="-fx-base: #ff0000" mnemonicParsing="false" onAction="#handleUserInput" prefHeight="41.0" prefWidth="76.0" text="Enter" />
<ScrollPane fx:id="scrollPane" hbarPolicy="NEVER" hvalue="1.0" prefHeight="557.0" prefWidth="400.0" vvalue="1.0">
